TopicTitle: [1.3 & 1.2] KSP-AVC Add-on Version Checker Plugin 1.1.6.2 - MiniAVC - KSP-AVC Online (2016-10-13)

Articles.Content:
21 minutes ago, New Horizons said:

I never used this mod before. For now I have 12 MiniAVC.dll files in in Gamedata. They are from from my 93 mod folders I guess. What shall I do, to improve this?

1) delete 11 of those 12 dlls? The remaining one will check for all updates correctly?

2) Install this mod here and everything might become better and less messed up?

3) Do nothing, because 12 dll do not worsen loading times or performance in any way?

I'd go with option 2 - It'll will consolidate all the output from those 12 mods, as well as any other mods that you have that have .version files that may not ship MiniAVC.

Option 1 won't work - it would just disable version checking on those 11 mods.  Option 3 is likely fine - there's a very minor hit during loading for each .dll, but it will be very minor.  If you install this mod you can remove all 12 of those to eliminate any impact they might have, but you'll probably not notice either way.

2 minutes ago, linuxgurugamer said:

Delete them. No harm will happen.

What version of KSP are you running?

I am running on KSP 1.7.3. But my mods are a nice mixture. If I deleted that dlls all without installing your mod, there won't be any update suggestions, right? I wish to have such tip, but only once for each mod. Today they appear 2-3 times on start up.

3 minutes ago, New Horizons said:

I am running on KSP 1.7.3. But my mods are a nice mixture. If I deleted that dlls all without installing your mod, there won't be any update suggestions, right? I wish to have such tip, but only once for each mod. Today they appear 2-3 times on start up.

Correct.

I am very delighted by this mod. It already helped me to update 3 mods. But sometimes it can by risky. It suggested an update of Community Category Kit, but I don't know where it was bundled with and may by its bundled-father depends on this exact version. So I focus on updating on yet known standalone mods.

Thanks for all your help and encouraging.

Nice.

Edited December 23, 2020 by theleg

Windows 10, all mods up to date, happens just with zero mini avc installed, after deleting the folder the issue is gone and there are just some dependency problems from mods that need zero mini avc

Problem accurs very quickly after launching the game, it gets stuck at "loading part upgrades"

I hope that's everything needed

4 hours ago, Neros7 said:

I'm sorry I forgot

Logs: https://mega.nz/file/iwhyCbKR#8guFh8N_TfMG8Bl3gUaKjqRT42cl9xLOEZT2pVGgr0s

Apparently not the correct log files, most of those mods that you listed aren't in the log file.  At the very least, I would have expected to see a list of all the folders for all the mods, and all that's listed in the file are about a dozen or so.

 

Just an FYI, while CkAN says it's a dependency, it really isn't, so you can delete the directory after the install and it will be fine.

I'd also suggest updating to KSP 1.12.3
